optionContent.option: He should act on Emma's request to help support a fellow employee.
Dan shouldn't provide any medical information directly in the email, but he could send out a link to Emma’s blog.
Instead of sending a company-wide email, Dan suggests that Emma ask Sandy if they can do anything to help.

incorrect.text: Dan sends an email out to all Johnson Controls employees with information regarding Sandy’s accident and a link to Emma’s blog.

partial.text: Dan sends out an email with a link to Emma’s blog. He doesn’t seem to realize this is an improper use of the employee email list.

correct.text: When Emma asks what she can do to help, Sandy suggests that Emma could tell a few of her friends at work about the Facebook page her family set up.

Emma shares this information with only the people Sandy suggests. Her co-workers post get-well messages, which boosts Sandy’s spirits. Quite a few people donate to the fund for Sandy’s medical expenses, which helps to ease her worries.
